title: Baseline Evaluation for Music Education Student
chief_complaint: I am studying music education and want to get my hearing evaluated to establish a baseline. I don't have any specific problems right now.

problem_summary.associated_symptoms: None; denies hearing loss, tinnitus, and dizziness.
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Hearing conservation and baseline establishment due to music exposure.

history.present_illness: The patient is an 18-year-old music education student. He has played piano and sung for most of his life.
history.otologic_history: Denies history of ear infections or surgeries.
history.noise_exposure_history: Music student. Began using non-custom musician earplugs a few months ago when practicing.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally. Thresholds are within normal limits (0-15 dB HL) across all frequencies.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: SRT is in agreement with PTA. Word recognition scores are excellent (100%) bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.key_findings: Normal tympanograms (Type A) bilaterally, indicating normal middle ear function.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.key_findings: Acoustic reflexes present and normal for ipsilateral and contralateral stimulation from 500 to 4,000 Hz. Reflex decay was negative at 500 and 1,000 Hz.

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient presents with normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally. Speech audiometry confirms excellent word recognition ability consistent with pure-tone thresholds. Middle ear function is normal as evidenced by Type A tympanograms and robust acoustic reflexes. There are no signs of retrocochlear pathology.
counseling_points: Your hearing test results are completely normal today, which gives us a great baseline for the future.
It is excellent that you are already using hearing protection during practice. Please continue to use your non-custom earplugs.

Since you are pursuing a career in music, you might benefit from custom musician earplugs in the future. These are molded to your ears and provide a flatter sound quality, making music sound more natural while still protecting you.
We recommend you continue to monitor your hearing annually given your regular exposure to music.
notes_for_actor: You are a healthy, proactive 18-year-old student.
You are not worried about your hearing; you are just being responsible because of your major.
You are open to advice about hearing protection.
